basis: The user explicitly commits to a stepwise plan (Option A, Option B, logging, post-log check-in) and conveys steady motivation, repeatedly affirming the actions theyâ€™ll take.
cognitive_dissonance: Low. The user aligns beliefs (BED management) with planned behaviors and expresses confidence, with only brief acknowledgment of BED challenges.
negative_thought_patterns: Occasional mild all-or-nothing language (e.g., 'BED is tough'), but generally reframes to actionable steps; limited defeatist beliefs.
emotional_triggers: Cravings, heat/physical discomfort, and BED-related stress; motivation increases with clear structure and control.
coaching_notes: Maintain concise, concrete plans; reinforce post-log reflection and quick tweaks if cravings persist; celebrate small wins to sustain momentum.
